snippet: The State Department announced that it had authorized $33 million in rewards for information on the location of seven leaders of the Shabab militants.
abstract: United States government announces $33 million in rewards for information on the location of top terrorist suspects in Somalia in an effort to get residents there to turn in leaders of the Shabab militant Islamist group; Shabab’s leaders have proved elusive, narrowly escaping American airstrikes several times.
lead_paragraph: The State Department announced that it had authorized $33 million in rewards for information on the location of seven leaders of the Shabab militants.

headline.seo: $33 Million Offered in Search for Shabab in Somalia
headline.main: United States Offers Rewards in Hunt for Somali Militants
headline.print_headline: United States Offers Rewards In Hunt for Somali Militants
